geneVariantDescriptions.description: ATP7B K832R lies within a cytoplasmic domain of the Atp7b protein (UniProt.org). K832R (corresponds to K552R in drosophila) results in developmental defects and reduced survival in drosophila (PMID: 28119449), impaired growth in a yeast assay (PMID: 30702195), decreased copper transport activity, but intact Atp7b ATPase activity in vitro assays (PMID: 22240481).

references.title: In Vivo Modeling of the Pathogenic Effect of Copper Transporter Mutations That Cause Menkes and Wilson Diseases, Motor Neuropathy, and Susceptibility to Alzheimer's Disease.
Complex ATP7B mutation patterns in Wilson disease and evaluation of a yeast model for functional analysis of variants.
Diverse functional properties of Wilson disease ATP7B variants.
